content.description: Start as low as you can on the arete on the backside of the Trailside boulder. The start is about two feet to the left of Angles Direct and Angles of Chance. Two small crimps for start, up to sloper on the arete, then a big move to the top.
content.location: On the backside of the Trailside boulder (facing away from the trail towards The Fin).

content.description: Start on a low edge and move up to a large slopey triangle feature. From there, move right into a crack around the side, then up to a slopey edge to top out.
content.location: On the side of the Trailside boulder facing the trail, far left-hand corner. If coming from the Reflections boulder and the right-hand fork at the parking lot it will be on your immediate left when you come to the Trailside boulder.

content.description: Starting down low on the far right corner of the backside of the Trailside boulder, traverse your way along the lip on sloper edges to the far left top corner and top out.
content.location: Far-right of the backside of the trailside boulder, finishing top-left.

content.description: Start to the right of Ember on a good edge standing up. Get high feet and use small crimps to top out straight above.
content.location: To the right of Ember on the Trailside boulder. This side faces the trail.

content.description: Sit start far left on the side of the Trailside boulder facing the trail near the start of Triangulation (V4). Use edges above the lip and some holds below the roof to traverse into the top of Ember and top out there. Crux is the first couple moves and then merging into Ember above the roof. Toping out can feel a little pumpy after all that hard work.
content.location: Sit start far left on the side of the Trailside boulder facing the trail near the start of Triangulation (V4). Use edges above the lip and some holds below the roof to traverse into the top of Ember and top out there.

content.description: Start sitting down low on two good undercut edges, move to some side pulls and edges over the lip then use good holds to get to the top. The crux is near the start.
content.location: On the side of the boulder facing the trail, at the highest point in the middle of the boulder. There will be chalk on the holds. Start down low.

content.description: Start on the same two good holds that Ember starts on underneath the roof, make a move with your right hand out to a big hold on the lip, then grab a hold out left and swing a foot up. Move your right hand to a good edge, then your left into a gaston undercling allowing you to bring both feet up onto the lip to stand up. This is the crux. Top out with a small crack near the top and various slopers.
content.location: Uses the same starts holds as Ember on the Trailside boulder (directly up the center face) but exits left over the small roof.

content.description: Start on the same start as Angles Direct - a small crack on the backside of the Trailside boulder. Move left to a side pull and then slap up with your right hand to a sloper over the lip. Move left hand up, bump, and top out.
content.location: On the trailside boulder around the backside. Same start as Angles Direct.

content.description: Lower Sit start to Angles Direct. One hand starts close to the arete/edge down low and the other is on the start to Angles Direct. Use beta for Angles Direct from there.
content.location: Around the side of the Trailside boulder facing away from the trail. You will see chalk in small crack holds.

content.description: Start in the chalky crack on the backside of the trailside boulder at about head height. Throw to a small pocket directly up and over the edge from the crack, then top out.
content.location: If coming on the trail from the right fork (from the parking lot), the trailside boulder is on your left. Continue around the roof facing the trail to the left and Angles Direct will be revealed.

content.description: A large boulder directly off the trail, there is a decent-sized roof on the side closest to the trail. Around the backside of the boulder opposite of the trail, there is a small roof with a couple of problems. This boulder is in an area with several others, including the Woolly Mammoth boulder.
